intro: Crepis sonchifolia, commonly known as the common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant has basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and hairy, while the upper leaves are more elongated. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is an annual or biennial herb that can grow up to 30 cm tall.
